intro: Neostachyanthus, commonly known as the "scented orchid," is a genus of flowering plants native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is characterized by its fragrant, showy flowers. The plants typically have long, slender stems and produce clusters of small, colorful blooms. Neostachyanthus species are often found in tropical rainforests, growing as epiphytes on tree trunks or in shaded understories. Their unique floral structure and aromatic properties make them popular in horticultural collections.
